intro: Alococarpum, commonly known as the "spiny tree" or "false hibiscus," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Meliaceae. It is characterized by its woody structure, compound leaves, and showy, often fragrant flowers. The genus includes several species, many of which are native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. Alococarpum plants typically have small, elliptical or ovate leaves and produce fruit that is a capsule containing numerous seeds. These plants are often found in moist, shaded environments and can be used in traditional medicine for their various therapeutic properties.
